description.narrative: The International Development Association (IDA) is an international financial institution which offers concessional loans and grants to the world's poorest developing countries. The IDA is a member of the World Bank Group and complements the existing the existing International Bank for Reconstruction and Development by lending to developing countries which suffer from the lowest gross national income, from troubled creditworthiness, or from the lowest per capita income. IDA 16 donors supported a renewed focus on major policy issues, including better measurement and communication of results, increased allocations to small states, and the establishment of a permanent crisis response window (CRW) within IDA to strengthen response to crises. Funding under this initiative represents a core grant payment Australia's contribution to IDA16. The total value of this initiative is $106.0 million to be expensed over the period 10 June 2011 to 30 June 2017.
